titles.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to ensure equitable treatment for members of the Armed Forces from outside the continental United States in the provision of excess leave and permissive temporary duty in connection with the separation of the members from the Armed Services.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1233)
Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Forces and Personnel.

bill.summary: 5/12/1993--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of Defense to ensure that a member of the armed forces whose home of record is outside the continental United States and who is stationed inside the continental United States at the time of separation shall be eligible to receive the same amount of excess leave or permissive temporary duty as a member who is stationed overseas. Directs the Secretary to report to the Congress describing other areas of possible inequitable treatment of such members.
